clinical_study.brief_title: Operational Research for Cryptococcal Antigen Screening
clinical_study.official_title: Operational Research for Cryptococcal Antigen Screening to Improve ART Survival

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

collaborator.agency: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

clinical_study.source: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

brief_summary.textblock: This will be a stepped wedge randomized trial design to evaluate the implementation of cryptococcal antigen (CRAG) screening and preemptive anti-fungal therapy of HIV-infected persons entering antiretroviral therapy (ART) outpatient treatment in Uganda. Those who are ART eligible with a CD4≤100 cells/mcL will have a serum/plasma CRAG performed by lateral flow assay. Those who are CRAG-positive and asymptomatic will be treated with high dose fluconazole. After 6 months survival with retention-in-care will be compared between those who are CRAG+ and CRAG negative

primary_outcome.description: before/after CRAG screening implementation (All persons) CRAG positive persons treated with high-dose fluconazole as compared to 6-month survival of CRAG negative persons who are eligible for antiretroviral therapy.

secondary_outcome.description: Cryptococcal meningitis-free survival time in those who are asymptomatic CRAG positive and treated with fluconazole compared to CRAG-negative persons with CD4<100 cells/mcL
Survival time among CRAG+ vs. CRAG negative persons with CD4<100 cells/mcL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Uptake of CRAG screening and preemptive treatment
Time from CRAG+ test to receipt of fluconazole therapy

secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with early discontinuation of fluconazole for any reason (e.g. non-compliance, adverse event)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants with symptomatic cryptococcal meningitis
Risk factors for symptomatic cryptococcal meningitis

arm_group.description: Cryptococcal Antigen (CrAg) Screening with preemptive antifungal treatment per World Health Organization (WHO) guidelines. Randomized Stepped Wedge design of phased implementation.

intervention.description: Fluconazole 800mg orally daily for 2 weeks, then 400mg daily for 8 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- HIV-1 infection
- CD4≤100 cells/mcL
- Cryptococcal antigen (CRAG) positive
- age >14 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Suspected Cryptococcal meningitis
- Prior known history of cryptococcal meningitis
- currently receiving HIV antiretroviral therapy
- Allergy to any azole antifungal medication
- Persons with known serious hepatic co-morbidities, transaminitis, or clinical jaundice who should not receive fluconazole in the opinion of the study investigator.
- Current known pregnancy
